node.title: Cook Islands detects first case of Covid-19
node.description: The person with coronavirus is a close contact of an Auckland case, and is isolating at their holiday accommodation, Prime Minister Mark Brown says.

node.title: Kaiapoi factory fire was accidental - investigators
node.description: The Sutton Tools factory in the north Canterbury town went up in flames last month, flushing about 3000 litres of oil into three nearby rivers.

node.title: 'A tricky situation': University 'waits it out' for solution to protest that closes campus
node.description: Victoria University of Wellington is backing the police's cautious approach to handling the protest that has closed its city campus and seen staff and students abused. Audio

node.title: Russia-Ukraine standoff: What you need to know now
node.description: The U.S. warns a Russian attack on Ukraine could come at "any time," but neither side has abandoned diplomacy yet.

node.title: Justin Trudeau invokes emergency powers to quell protests
node.description: "These blockades are illegal, and if you are still participating, the time to go home is now," he declared.

node.title: Sadowski-Synnott cruises through Big Air qualifying
node.description: Snowboarder Zoi Sadowski-Synnott's quest for a second Winter Olympic Games gold medal is off to a smooth start.

node.title: Medical physicists to strike tomorrow after stalled pay negotiations with DHBs
node.description: The 48-hour full strike comes after 12 weeks of partial strike action, which has seen physicists refuse to operate machinery outside of ordinary hours.

node.title: An allergy-friendly cookie company finds sweet success after rejection
node.description: She started her business after finding out her daughter was allergic to corn during an emergency room visit.

node.title: Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, tests positive for Covid-19
node.description: The Duchess of Cornwall is self-isolating after testing positive for Covid-19, Clarence House has confirmed.

node.title: Council taken to task over abandoned Ōtāhuhu town centre upgrade
node.description: Auckland Council is being asked to finish what it started after a multi-million dollar upgrade of Ōtāhuhu's town centre was put on the back-burner.

node.title: 'It's created a big mess": Farmers despair over ruined crops
node.description: Weeks of persistent rain have left arable crops sodden and led to farmers describing this season as the harvest from hell.

node.title: 'This is crazy': Shortfall in booster numbers worries top Covid-19 adviser
node.description: The one million New Zealanders who are so far delaying getting their booster shots are the biggest concern of top Covid-19 adviser Sir David Skegg. Audio

node.title: Father of Parkland victim climbs crane to call for action on gun violence
node.description: Oliver, whose 17-year-old son Joaquin was killed four years ago in the shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, dropped a banner with a message for President Joe Biden.

node.title: Chartered accountants intent on reducing $60K gender pay gap
node.description: A new playbook has been launched to combat the gender pay gap in the accounting sector, with efforts to change the perception around why it is important to address the gap.

node.title: Canada protest: Trudeau to invoke rarely used emergency powers - media
node.description: The Canadian Prime Minister will invoke rarely used special measures allowing him to tackle protests that have shut some border crossings and paralysed downtown Ottawa, local media reports say.

node.title: Sister of man who died after hospital window fall says changes are needed
node.description: The family of a man who died after falling two storeys out of a Palmerston North Hospital window say urgent changes are needed to avoid a repeat.

node.title: Number of people crossing New Zealand border lowest in 50 years
node.description: Closed borders and other Covid-19 restrictions have resulted in the number of people crossing the border falling to the lowest in 50 years, while the country has had its first migration loss in nine…

node.title: Republicans still back Trump but don't want party to punish disloyalty
node.description: Republicans prefer that party moves on from January 6 and talks about issues like economy, crime and immigration.

node.title: Texas sues Facebook parent Meta over facial recognition data
node.description: Facebook should have obtained users' consent before identifying them in photos, according to the suit.

node.title: Trump accounting firm recants a decade of his financial statements
node.description: The firm, Mazars USA, wrote that the Trump Organization's statements of financial condition "should no longer be relied upon."

node.title: Woman stabbed to death in Chinatown apartment
node.description: Christina Yuna Lee was allegedly followed up six flights of stairs by 25-year-old suspect Assamad Nash.

node.title: Rare baby ghost shark found in ocean off the South Island
node.description: Even scientists who study the deep-water sharks have seen precious few of them, and newly hatched ghost shark finds are rarer still. Audio

node.title: $3m bill to clean dioxin out of New Plymouth wastewater treatment plant
node.description: A $3 million clean-up operation to remove highly toxic dioxin from the New Plymouth wastewater treatment plant has sparked calls for an investigation into where else the compound may be lurking.

node.title: Omicron outbreak: Isolation changes, return-to-work testing as NZ heads to 'phase two'
node.description: Fewer people will be considered Covid-19 contacts and isolation requirements will be relaxed as the country enters phase two of the strategy for Omicron tomorrow.

node.title: Businesses near Parliament struggling with protest on doorstep
node.description: Businesses near Parliament say they are only just holding on, with customers scared off by the massive group of protesters occupying the grounds.

node.title: Americans win Olympic gold and silver in women's monobob
node.description: Kaillie Humphries brings home gold weeks after becoming a U.S. citizen. The silver is the 4th Olympic medal for Elana Meyers Taylor.

node.title: Trades sector sees wage growth across the board
node.description: The country's industrial and trades sector has seen near universal wage growth, with employers feeling the effects of a tight labour market.

node.title: Police road safety operation misses the target
node.description: A nationwide police operation to cut down on high-risk driving and road deaths has gone badly, an OIA reveals.

node.title: Ransomware gang claims it hacked San Francisco 49ers
node.description: The NFL team said In a statement that it recently became aware of a "network security incident."

node.title: Rogue ram meets unfortunate end after bruising encounters on cycle trail
node.description: An aggressive ram in Central Otago has been butting heads with cyclists on the popular Lake Dunstan Trail.
